text: It really annoys me that Tiara took that 6 lethal damage since there was no possible way for her or anyone else to have known that their perspective changed. There was a difference of about 5 seconds between the DM telling Tiara that she was fine from the previous stab and her committing to the rest of the stabs. Nothing else was said by anyone in between. There was nothing that could have possibly signified any change in perspective. Calli just confirmed that the Tiara that Kiara was in control of took no damage. So of course Kiara would assume that she would still be in control of the Tiara that wasn't stabbed in the leg. The rest of the session was fun to watch but this arbitrary perspective change really cheapened the mirror scene. It felt like it was done for the shock factor alone and not because it made sense.

text:
It's very cool to witness how the story unfolds and everyone plays their character.
Calli is doing good as the storyteller. Sure it's a bit rough here and there, but she is moving the plot along, not allowing the story to grind to a halt.
Ame, Gura, Ina and Kiara are getting used to roleplay quite well. I'm very curious to see how their characters evolve during the story.
The more i watch of these TTRPG streams, the more i wish i could play with them, or be the storyteller for them. There are some RPGs that i think could suit them very well.

And hey, if any of the girls (or anyone really) read this and if you like dark and gritty fantasyworlds, there is this TTRPG called "Shadow of the Demon Lord". It's set in a medieval fantasyworld with a bit of clockwork/steam-punk, one day touched by the Demonlords shadow, which will usher in the end of days. I'm playing it for years by now and love it to bits, from its dark themes to its clean and simple rules.

A little something for to translate for Kiara: "Viel Glück und Frohsinn auf eurer Reise durch fantastische Welten. Es gibt noch so viele Abenteuer zu erleben und Geschichten zu erzählen. Es lässt meine Seele strahlen das dieses wundervolle Hobby mit euch weiter wächst. Lacht, jubelt, zittert und weint mit euren Charakteren. Ich wünsche euch allen gemeinsam bezaubernde Momente."

That being said, have fun, enjoy your shared stories and play to your hearts content.

text:
At first I wondered why the Wyrm would want the service of Watoto, but then I look back on what Watoto has accomplished...

The Wonders of Watoto

• Tutorial Session: WATOTORIAL
- Grew a mushroom that can make you invisible.
- Constructed a bomb out of mushroom.
- According to the Game Master from the first re-cap episode, Father Watoto was supposed to have died. Watoto's intervention during his father's confrontation with a Nexus Crawler (probably) changed fate itself.

• Session 1: Enter Darkness
- The first party member to win the trust of Bird Lady Tiara, who doesn't like strangers.
- Constructed a lethal high frequency Sound Gun out of a speaker.
- Stripped a TV for half the parts needed to put together a decent car engine.
- Showed that the Sound Gun has a 'nice sound for doggies' mode.
- Discovered a maze by burning unburnable vine walls.

• Session 2: A World Between
- Showed that the Sound Gun also functions as a megaphone.
- Has won over Tiara's affections to the point of her trying to murder a then peaceful dog that attacked Watoto earlier. "Hey they attacked Watoto; I need to protect Watoto. They're dangerous."
- Convinced two very angry and bleeding from bullet wound dogs to eat a mushroom that drugged them into returning home.

• Session 3: Hunters Party Hard
- Found a bus token for a free bus ride at a bus stop. Yuul still bought a bus ticket for him.

• Session 3.5: Hunters Party Hard
- Drank his and Tiara's alcohol with the only ill effects for the little guy being a quick barf, which he used as a distraction that also broke his and Bird Lady's vampire induced paralysis/hypnosis.

• Session 4: The Circus Comes to Town
- Came up with plans that saved 15 kids and to steal the voodoo dolls of his team.

• Session 5: Seeing Double
- Ghosts kept trying to drag Watoto to his death while seemingly ignoring the rest of his party.

text: For anybody wondering, the "make a failure critical" thing about beads doesn't work like that. Kiara mistakenly rolled 3 dice for her check when she only had 1 die so she had to reroll but you can't choose to make failures with a single die a critical one since they automatically are. To gain beads with that you need to willingly turn a failed roll with multiple dice into a critical one, which you can do whenever you fail a roll.

author: @Hatchamv

text:
They're beats, not beads. As in musical beats.

And Calli is correct. If you have 1 die, then roll less than 8, you can turn that roll into a dramatic failure for a beat.

If you have 0 dice, then you get a chance die. This is not the same thing as having only 1 die in the roll. Chance dice fail on anything other than 10, and are an automatic dramatic failure on a 1.

The thing to remember is that having a chance die and having just 1 die in a pool are not equivalent.

text:
As soon as Calli said that Ina had "been there for a long time" and that the Yuul in the mirror was pointing a flashlight at her, I realized that the perspective had changed so that Yuul was now the one in the void of the mirror.

But what I don't get, that if the same switch happened to Tiara - and that the true Tiara IS the one stuck inside the mirror and she then stabbed the doll several times it affecting the Tiara in the mirror... why did SHE take 6 damage, if the true self is stuck in the mirror and didn't appear to take damage?

That's what caused my confusion. OR did Tiara actually act so hastily that before her perspective flipped, she went stabby and ended up damaging her true self that was in the mirror?
(Edit: Ah seems so)

And if the perspectives flipped so that instead of them being in the group setting they entered in, they were now individually trapped in a mirror void - how would Yuul and Scout be able to give Kiara first aid? Or.. are they also in a group in the mirrors?
 
Still, a very cool concept but... ended up feeling like it should've been pre-thought out a little better to reduce confusing scenarios. I suppose that a part of said confusion might be in part due to Calli's sleepless night though..

text:
@danic890  Along with what the other two said, the wishy washy changing of perspectives made the scenario even more confusing than it already was, and you could tell that Amelia, Kiara, and Gura failed to follow along because of it, and even Ina had a hard time parsing the events correctly. 

Calli ended up punishing Kiara for relying only on her intuition even though her intuition was correct. It made the entire scenario more confusing because of it, because that introduction made it (nearly) impossible to deduce the point of view at any given point in the session up to that point, since Calli gave herself the power to switch it at any time without verbal disclosure.
author: @SeeMyDolphin

text: @SeeMyDolphin  Ina on my view grasped the situation pretty decently. I don't really think it was that confusing to be honest,for me Calli explained it quite well just the holo members failed to grasp it. Calli punished kiara for exactly that "Relying on her intuition". You Shouldn't just jump to doing something like stabbing your mirror self 7 times without even considering what is happening. What if her mirror self was just another part of her and they were supposed to reunite?Instead shr just went ahead and tried to kill it,that's my main problem with it. The fact that we didn't know who were the real ones untill they visited the hall of mirrors in my opinion was a great plot Twist. Calli is deffinetly not in the wrong here
author: @danic890

text:
@danic890  I think Calli is a great DM; she's obviously putting a ton of work into each session and the doppelgangers was a neat idea.

But there's always room for improvement. The fact that all of the girls except for Ina were completely lost when they are Calli's primary intended demographic for this RP means that Calli failed in some way to properly convey the story. 

You can't blame her too much. She was tired and was intentionally trying to ride the line of mysterious and confusing. It's just the fact that even after breaking the fourth wall and directly explaining the situation, the majority of the girls were still having a problem following along shows that she didn't find a great balance on that line. 

Following your intuition is high risk, high reward. Under consistent rules Kiara should have been lucky and been rewarded. The fact that the rules weren't consistent made the scenario basically impossible to follow along without trying to meta-analyze Calli's authorial intent, which isn't an ideal RP experience in any way.
author: @SeeMyDolphin

text: But don't get me wrong; I'm not trying to say that Calli made a huge fuck up and completely ruined the session or anything. It all worked out in the end and managed to be entertaining, so it was still a success. It's just that, in my opinion, being consistent with the rules and being fair to Kiara would've smoothed out that segment a lot more, and I think it would've have benefited all five of them more than what Calli actually chose to do in the end. It's just a small improvement, but a good lesson to be learned I think.
author: @SeeMyDolphin

text: @SeeMyDolphin  I See your point and get what you are saying to a certain Extent. Maybe the Idea could have been conveyed a bit better. What is important in the end is that it was entertaining to see
